subject: Re: Raudive Diode Device #3
author: M.A. Coletta (Mike)
full_text:
Hi Ron,

From the book, "Voices from the Tapes":
' May it suffice to say that the experiments made with a diode were 
probably the best. Dr. Raudive's diode which we had carefully 
examined and then had a replica built for the actual experiments, is 
basically a piece of germanium with some metal on it. It will conduct 
elecetricity one way and not the other. It is no more thatn what was 
known as the "cat's whisker" in the crystal sets of early radio days. 
It acts in a similar way to a radio, but is not as sensative.'

It appears he received some good audio type signals using his Raudive 
Diode and his tape recorders, as the book illustrated throughout.

- Mike

> Greetings fellow researchers,
> I built another Raudive Diode Device ( #3) this evening. This one 
can be used in two configurations.
> 1) With the plug connected directly into the diode device and then 
into the recording device.
> 2) The plug connected to a cable and that cable connected to the 
diode device. The cable provides some isolation between the diode 
device and the recording device.
> I haven't tested it yet... that will be done tomorrow or the next 
day.
> You can see pictures and a schematic, here:
> http://ufomagazine. blogspot. com/2008/ 11/raudive- diode-device- 
3.html
